alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Keokuk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 1:12AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Keokuk, northwestern Johnson, southeastern Benton, northwestern Washington, northwestern Jefferson, southwestern Linn and eastern Iowa Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 111 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hedrick, or 11 miles northeast of Ottumwa, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hayesville around 120 AM CDT. Sigourney around 125 AM CDT. Harper around 130 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include North English, South English, Kinross, Parnell, Williamsburg, Oxford, Coralville, North Liberty, Tiffin and Amana. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 219 and 245. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
